item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #15
item.description: Larry Wall interviewed by Linux Voice, Neil McGovern AMA on Reddit, Purism Librem 13 review, manage your music from the command line and learn keyboard shortcuts.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #14
item.description: Important companies for Linux, Linus answered Slashdot user questions, the LibreBox now ships with Ubuntu MATE, Linux 4.1 released, the yes command and a curated list of shell resources.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #13
item.description: Doing good with Linux, speeding up Firefox, what to think of Google, learning about tcpdump and the Linux command line, and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #12
item.description: SourceForge spreads AdWare with open source software, creating a bootable USB drive, Fedora project leader AMA on Reddit, most accommodating laptops for Linux, software licenses in plain English and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #11
item.description: Cory Doctorow on mass surveillance, Richard Stallman on malware in proprietary software, Ubuntu MATE review, an online tool for learning Vim, a collection of privacy tools and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #10
item.description: Python 3 default in Ubuntu 16.04, Floss Weekly about Docker, Microsoft releases Code editor that runs on Linux, Working with the terminal and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #9
item.description: Build your own Linux Distro, do people use Chromebooks/Chrome OS exclusively, must have Chrome extensions, busy at work and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #8
item.description: Linus Torvalds on Git, what people miss from Linux, how software names came about, comparison of Unix shells and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #7
item.description: I switched from Unity to MATE, Chromebook sales increase, annoyances in Chrome OS, new Chromebook specs and statistics page, tools and resources for working with the shell and more.

item.title: Bits of Linux: 2015 #6
item.description: Code of Conflict for Linux kernel developers, basic Linux terminology, Bash parameter expansion basics, Chromebook Pixel officially announced and more.
